item.title: 5 Floor Exercises to Lose Belly Fat - News18
item.description:
5 Floor Exercises to Lose Belly Fat

Publication Date: January 19, 2025 | Source: News 18

This article outlines some effective floor exercises that can help in reducing belly fat.

  • Crunches: A classic exercise targeting the rectus abdominis muscles.
  • Bicycle Crunches: Engages both the upper and lower abdominal muscles.
  • Russian Twists: Excellent for targeting the oblique muscles.
  • Plank: A full-body exercise engaging core muscles.
  • Leg Raises: Targets the lower abdominal muscles.
These exercises are essential for anyone looking to strengthen their core and achieve a flatter stomach.

Incorporating these exercises into your routine can lead to significant improvements in core strength and the reduction of belly fat.

item.title: Kho Kho Kho: A 22-year-old’s journey from collecting scrap to stacking medals - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kho Kho Star Ramji Kashyap: From Scrap Collector to Champion

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Ramji Kashyap is transforming the narrative of a scrap collector into that of a kho kho champion as he competes at the kho kho World Cup, representing India.

  • Ramji grew up in Velapur, Maharashtra, collecting scrap with his family.
  • He developed a passion for kho kho while attending school.
  • Despite initial resistance from his family, he pursued a career in sport and became a well-known player.
  • Ramji has been recognized as the best player in the Ultimate Kho Kho league for two consecutive years.
  • His journey has garnered significant public attention, altering the perception of scrap collectors.
“Collecting bhangaar is not the sort of extreme poverty people understand.” - Coach Somanath Bansode

Ramji Kashyap's story is one of perseverance and redefining one's destiny, proving that with talent and determination, one can rise from humble beginnings to achieve greatness.

item.title: Mandana Karimi speaks out about her decision to quit acting: It’s hard to say no to money but… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mandana Karimi speaks out about her decision to quit acting: It’s hard to say no to money but…

Date: January 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Iranian actor-model Mandana Karimi has decided to leave acting behind to pursue a career in interior design and academia, stating that she never truly loved acting.

  • Mandana gained fame from Bigg Boss 9 and movies like Kya Kool Hai Hum 3.
  • She has been turning down all acting and modeling offers for nearly a year.
  • Karimi is now focusing on interior design and works as a visiting professor at various institutes.
  • She expresses gratitude for her acting career but indicates it was not a passion.
  • Karimi acknowledges the difficulty of saying no to money from acting roles.
  • She enjoys her new routine, balancing work and school.
“Acting was a job that I never loved, nor this industry. I am grateful for the time I spent there, but it wasn't something I was hungry for or crazy about.”

Mandana’s shift from acting to academia highlights her pursuit of passion and fulfillment over financial gain.

item.title: Report Reveals Gautam Gambhir-Rohit Sharma Split Over Champions Trophy Squad: "Wanted Sanju Samson.... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Report Reveals Gautam Gambhir-Rohit Sharma Split Over Champions Trophy Squad: "Wanted Sanju Samson..."

Publication Date: October 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir faced opposition in two key decisions regarding the Champions Trophy 2025 squad, leading to tense discussions with captain Rohit Sharma and chief selector Ajit Agarkar. Gambhir preferred Sanju Samson for wicket-keeper and Hardik Pandya as vice-captain, while Rohit and Agarkar chose Rishabh Pant and Shubman Gill, respectively.

  • Gambhir and Rohit had a long meeting about team selections.
  • Gambhir wanted Sanju Samson as wicket-keeper; Rohit backed Rishabh Pant.
  • Gambhir suggested Hardik Pandya for vice-captaincy; Rohit favored Shubman Gill.
  • Ajit Agarkar provided an update on Jasprit Bumrah's fitness regarding upcoming matches.
  • The final squad for the Champions Trophy is due by February 11, 2025.
"Bumrah has been told to off-load for five weeks... we are waiting on his fitness and will know his status in early February." - Ajit Agarkar

The controversy over the Champions Trophy squad reflects ongoing challenges within the Indian cricket team management as they prepare for critical upcoming matches.

item.title: 'Gautam Gambhir Wanted Hardik Pandya...": Report Reveals Split Over Champions Trophy Squad Selection.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Report Reveals Gautam Gambhir-Rohit Sharma Split Over Champions Trophy Squad: "Wanted Sanju Samson..."

Publication Date: October 27, 2024

Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir faced disagreement over key selections for the Champions Trophy 2025 squad. Disputes arose between Gambhir, captain Rohit Sharma, and chief selector Ajit Agarkar, particularly regarding the vice-captaincy and wicket-keeper position.

  • Gambhir preferred Hardik Pandya as vice-captain, while Rohit and Agarkar chose Shubman Gill.
  • For the wicket-keeper spot, Gambhir advocated for Sanju Samson, but Rishabh Pant was selected instead.
  • Ajit Agarkar mentioned that Jasprit Bumrah may not be fit for the first two ODIs against England.
  • The final squad for the Champions Trophy is due to the ICC by February 11.
  • India will play three ODIs against England starting February 6.
“We'll probably find out a bit more around that time. What exactly (it is) and with regards to what his medical condition is, I'm sure BCCI might just put something out from the physio itself.” – Ajit Agarkar

This internal conflict highlights the challenges within the Indian cricket hierarchy as they prepare for an important international tournament.

item.description:
Trump likely to visit India and China within 100 days of presidency: Report

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

Former US President Donald Trump is reportedly planning visits to India and China within the first 100 days of his upcoming presidency.

“A strong international presence is crucial for the new administration.”

This trip could mark a pivotal moment in re-establishing diplomatic ties and trade relations with these key nations.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18 GRAND FINALE: Rajat Dalal, Vivian Dsena Or Karan Veer Mehra - Who Is Winning The Trophy? AI Reveals Results - News24
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18 GRAND FINALE: Rajat Dalal, Vivian Dsena Or Karan Veer Mehra – Who Is Winning The Trophy? AI Reveals Results

Date: January 19, 2025 Source: News24

After three intense months, Bigg Boss 18 is nearing its grand finale with six contestants vying for the title. AI predictions based on social media trends offer insights into potential winners.

Key Points:

  • Final episode airing on January 19 at 8 pm.
  • Strong contenders according to Gemini AI: Rajat Dalal and Vivian Dsena.
  • Vivian Dsena leads in popularity according to X-Grok results.
  • Karan Veer Mehra is favored by audiences, particularly shown by Blackbox AI.
  • The finale will feature special performances and guest appearances.
“On JioCinema’s official YouTube poll, Vivian received 44% of votes, with Rajat Dalal and Karan Veer Mehra trailing behind at 26% and 24% respectively.”

The finale promises excitement and a captivating atmosphere filled with performances and guest stars.

item.title: Best phones to buy under ₹40,000 in January 2025: OnePlus 13R, iQOO Neo 9 Pro and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Best phones to buy under ₹40,000 in January 2025

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Live Mint

With a plethora of smartphones available to buy under the sub ₹40,000 price segment, it can become hard to choose the right device that matches your specific needs. In order to help make the buying choice easier, we have compiled a list of top smartphones in this range with many notable brands in the reckoning including OnePlus, Realme, iQOO, Vivo and Motorola.

  • OnePlus 13R: Features a 6.78-inch 120Hz ProXDR AMOLED display with Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 SoC.
  • iQOO Neo 9 Pro: Comes with a 6.78-inch 1.5K AMOLED panel and is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 8+ Gen 2.
  • Realme GT 6: Offers a 6.78-inch LTPO AMOLED display and runs on Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 chipset.
  • Vivo T3 Ultra: Has a 6.78-inch 3D curved AMOLED screen, driven by MediaTek Dimensity 9200+ chip.
  • Motorola Edge 50 Pro: Features Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 chipset with a 6.7-inch FHD+ P-OLED display.
“These phones combine advanced technology with affordability, making them ideal for tech-savvy consumers.”

In summary, the article highlights top smartphone options under ₹40,000, catering to different preferences in performance, display, and camera features.

item.title: Woman tourist, instructor die in paragliding accident in North Goa: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Woman tourist and instructor die in paragliding accident in North Goa: Report

Date: Jan 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic paragliding accident in North Goa claimed the lives of a 27-year-old woman tourist from Pune and her Nepalese instructor, highlighting ongoing safety concerns in adventure sports.

  • The accident occurred at Keri Plateau, Goa, when their paraglider crashed into a ravine.
  • Shivani Dable was paragliding with an illegal operator named Shekhar Raizada.
  • A case has been registered for endangering human life.
  • This incident follows similar paragliding fatalities in Himachal Pradesh within 24 hours.
“The paraglider plunged into a ravine soon after it took off from a cliff.”

This incident raises serious safety concerns regarding paragliding regulations and the operation of adventure sports companies.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire and hostage release set to begin; Israeli troops start withdrawing from Rafah - The Hindu
item.description:
Gaza Ceasefire and Hostage Release Set to Begin

Date: January 19, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

A ceasefire in Gaza between Israel and Hamas is set to come into effect on Sunday (January 19, 2025) morning with a hostage release to follow hours later, opening the way to a possible end to a 15-month war that has upended the Middle East.

  • Israeli forces have begun withdrawing from areas in Gaza's Rafah to the Philadelphi corridor.
  • The ceasefire agreement followed negotiations brokered by Egypt, Qatar, and the United States.
  • The first stage of the ceasefire will last six weeks, with 33 hostages released in exchange for almost 2,000 Palestinian prisoners.
  • Three female hostages are expected to be released on January 19.
  • The accord includes a phased release of additional hostages in subsequent weeks.
The war was triggered by Hamas' October 7, 2023, attack on southern Israel, killing 1,200 people and taking more than 250 hostage.

While the ceasefire aims to end the war, the future of Gaza remains uncertain due to the lack of a comprehensive postwar agreement.

item.title: Trump likely to sign 100 executive orders on day one - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Trump Likely to Sign 100 Executive Orders on Day One

Date: January 19, 2025 / 08:09 IST

Source: Moneycontrol

When Donald Trump walks into the White House Monday afternoon, over 100 executive orders will be ready for him to sign, aimed at fulfilling his campaign promises.

  • Trump stated he would be signing a "record-setting" number of executive actions on his first day.
  • Executive orders carry the force of law and do not require Congressional approval.
  • Trump mentioned that these executive orders would surpass the number of 100.
  • He will be inaugurated as the 47th President of the United States on January 20.
“We have a record-setting number of documents that I’ll be signing right after this (inauguration) speech,” - Donald Trump.

Trump's actions on his first day will set the tone for his second term, with a focus on rapidly implementing his agenda.

item.title: Rare ‘planetary parade’ to adorn night skies from January 21. Know significance & how to watch - ThePrint
item.description:
Rare ‘planetary parade’ to adorn night skies from January 21. Know significance & how to watch

Publication Date: N/A | Source: ThePrint

A rare celestial event will adorn the night skies of India through early March, starting 21 January. Seven planets will line up for a ‘planetary parade’, some of which will be visible to the naked eye.

  • The parade begins with four visible planets: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars.
  • By mid-February, Mercury, Neptune, and Uranus will also join.
  • The last similar event occurred in 2022.
  • NASA encourages people to observe the planets each evening this month.
“The exciting part of this parade is that most of these planets will be visible to the naked eye. You might need a telescope to view Neptune and Uranus,” - Virendra Yadav, ARIES

This planetary parade will be a wonderful opportunity for amateur astronomers and stargazers to witness a rare alignment of planets.

item.title: "Smog, Dirt...": Danish Star Mia Blichfeldt Blasts Playing Conditions At India Open Badminton - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Mia Blichfeldt Criticizes India Open Badminton Conditions as Unhealthy

Publication Date: January 19, 2025

Source: NDTV

Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt has voiced strong criticism of the playing conditions at the India Open Super 750 tournament in Delhi, labeling them as "unhealthy and unacceptable". Despite battling a stomach infection, she managed to compete but ultimately lost her match.

  • Blichfeldt highlighted the adverse conditions including pollution and cleanliness issues.
  • The Badminton Association of India faced logistical challenges due to late venue access.
  • This incident is part of a larger pattern, as other players have also reported poor conditions in past tournaments.
“It’s really hard to accept that many weeks of work and preparing gets wasted because of bad conditions.” – Mia Blichfeldt

It remains to be seen how the Badminton Association of India will address these ongoing concerns and improve conditions for future events.

item.description:
Donald Trump's India Visit: PM Modi’s White House Invite Possible Soon

Date: Jan 19, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Donald Trump, soon to be inaugurated as US President, is considering visits to India and China, with plans for a possible meeting with PM Modi at the White House in spring.

  • Trump has discussed a trip to India possibly in April or later this year.
  • Discussions were held with Indian officials prior to the inauguration concerning strengthening bilateral relations.
  • Trump aims to deepen ties with China as well, amidst previous threats regarding tariffs.
“I just spoke to Chairman Xi Jinping of China. It is my expectation that we will solve many problems together, and starting immediately.” - Donald Trump

Trump’s visit and meetings could signify important developments in US-India relations.

item.title: Sabalenka routs Andreeva for 18th straight Australian Open win - WTA Tennis
item.description:
Sabalenka routs Andreeva for 18th straight Australian Open win

Date: 2 hrs ago • Source: WTA Tennis

World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka rolled into her third straight Australian Open quarterfinal with a 6-1, 6-2 win over Mirra Andreeva on Sunday in Melbourne, her 18th consecutive win at the tournament.

  • Sabalenka broke Andreeva's serve four times and saved all three break points she faced.
  • She has now tied Victoria Azarenka for the longest winning streak at the Australian Open this decade.
  • Sabalenka is undefeated in the current season, with a 9-0 record.
  • She has reached the quarterfinals or better at 11 of the last 15 Grand Slam tournaments.
"It's always tough matches against Mirra; she's so young but so mature and playing such great tennis." - Aryna Sabalenka

Sabalenka's performance continues to demonstrate her strong form and dominance on the court, particularly at the Australian Open.

item.title: 10 fruits you should include in breakfast for a healthier diet - Hindustan Times
item.description:
10 Fruits to Include in Your Breakfast for a Healthier Diet

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

This article highlights ten fruits that you should incorporate into your breakfast to enhance your diet with important nutrients and flavors.

  • Bananas: Lower blood pressure and aid digestion.
  • Blueberries: Loaded with antioxidants for brain health.
  • Cantaloupe: Hydrates and provides vitamins A and C.
  • Cranberries: Support digestion and heart health.
  • Grapefruit: Rich in vitamins C and A, potassium, and fiber.
  • Kiwi: Aids digestion and supports heart health.
  • Raspberries: May have cancer-fighting properties.
  • Orange Juice: Enhances iron absorption in the body.
  • Strawberries: High in antioxidants supporting heart health.
  • Watermelon: Hydrates and protects heart health.
“Fruits are rich in potassium, fiber, vitamin C, and folate—nutrients essential for your body.”

Incorporating these fruits into your daily breakfast can improve your overall health and provide a delicious start to your day.

item.title: 7 small changes in our habits that protect our heart diseases - The Times of India
item.description:
7 Small Changes to Protect Your Heart Health

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Your heart is a hardworking organ that never takes a break, so it’s only fair we treat it with a little extra care! Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is the leading cause of deaths worldwide, killing an estimated 17.9 million people each year. Here are 7 habits that can help protect your heart.

  • Start your day with warm lemon water to boost hydration and reduce inflammation.
  • Spend time laughing to release endorphins and improve blood vessel function.
  • Swap phone scrolling for a brisk 10-minute walk after meals to lower blood sugar.
  • Practice deep breathing for one minute every few hours to reduce stress.
  • Snack on nuts instead of chips for better heart health.
  • Replace late-night coffee with herbal tea to support relaxation and heart health.
  • Keep a gratitude journal to lower stress and improve mood.
“A happy mind leads to a healthier heart.”

By incorporating these small changes into daily life, individuals can significantly enhance their heart health and wellbeing.

item.title: Centre-farmer talks on Feb 14, fasting Dallewal agrees to medical aid - The Tribune India
item.description:
Centre-farmer talks on Feb 14, fasting Dallewal agrees to medical aid

Publication Date: February 2023

Source: The Tribune

The Centre has invited farm leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal for talks aimed at potentially concluding the year-long farmers' protest, during which he has been fasting for 54 days. Dallewal has agreed to undergo medical treatment upon pleas from fellow farmers.

  • Dallewal invited to talks on February 14 in Chandigarh.
  • He has been fasting for 54 days at the Khanauri border.
  • The government has conditioned discussions on Dallewal agreeing to treatment.
  • Protesting farmers are considering a proposal from the Centre regarding their demands.
  • Over 40 farmers have reportedly died during the protests.
“We have received a decent proposal and are discussing its modalities.” - Kaka Singh Kotra

This meeting marks the first formal dialogue since February of the previous year amid ongoing protests against the government's agricultural policies.
